intro: Boechera rollinsiorum, commonly known as the Rollins' rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has small, pinnately divided leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
